is_active.description: IsActive indicates whether the address is currently used or just known.

address.description: Address is the multiaddress via which we are connected with the peer.

direction.description: Direction is which way the connection was established.

latency.description: Latency is the last known round trip time to the peer in ms.

streams.description: Streams returns list of streams established with the peer.

id.description: id is an identifier used to write protocol headers in streams.

device_pk.title: device_pk is the public key of the device sending the message

public_rendezvous_seed.title: public_rendezvous_seed is the rendezvous seed used by the current account
public_rendezvous_seed is the rendezvous seed used by the current account

enabled.title: enabled indicates if incoming contact requests are enabled

public_rendezvous_seed.title: public_rendezvous_seed is the rendezvous seed used by the current account

peer_ids.title: peer_ids is the list of peer ids connected to the same group

cid.title: cid is the CID of the IPFS log entry

parent_cids.title: parent_cids is the list of the parent entries

metadata_event_type.title: event_type metadata event type if subscribed to metadata events

device_pk.title: device_pk is the public key of the device signing the entry

payload.title: payload is the un encrypted entry payload if available

group_pk.title: group_pk is the public key of the group

group_type.title: group_type is the type of the group

contact_pk.title: contact_pk is the contact public key if appropriate

contact.description: shareable_contact is the decoded shareable contact.

id.title: id is the CID of the underlying OrbitDB event

parent_ids.title: id are the the CIDs of the underlying parents of the OrbitDB event

v1EventContext.title: EventContext adds context (its id, its parents and its attachments) to an event

v1EventType.title:
- EventTypeUndefined: EventTypeUndefined indicates that the value has not been set. Should not happen.
 - EventTypeGroupMemberDeviceAdded: EventTypeGroupMemberDeviceAdded indicates the payload includes that a member has added their device to the group
 - EventTypeGroupDeviceChainKeyAdded: EventTypeGroupDeviceChainKeyAdded indicates the payload includes that a member has sent their device chain key to another member
 - EventTypeAccountGroupJoined: EventTypeAccountGroupJoined indicates the payload includes that the account has joined a group
 - EventTypeAccountGroupLeft: EventTypeAccountGroupLeft indicates the payload includes that the account has left a group
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestDisabled: EventTypeAccountContactRequestDisabled indicates the payload includes that the account has disabled incoming contact requests
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestEnabled: EventTypeAccountContactRequestEnabled indicates the payload includes that the account has enabled incoming contact requests
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestReferenceReset: EventTypeAccountContactRequestReferenceReset indicates the payload includes that the account has a new contact request rendezvous seed
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestOutgoingEnqueued: EventTypeAccountContactRequestOutgoingEnqueued indicates the payload includes that the account will attempt to send a new contact request
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestOutgoingSent: EventTypeAccountContactRequestOutgoingSent indicates the payload includes that the account has sent a contact request
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestIncomingReceived: EventTypeAccountContactRequestIncomingReceived indicates the payload includes that the account has received a contact request
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestIncomingDiscarded: EventTypeAccountContactRequestIncomingDiscarded indicates the payload includes that the account has ignored a contact request
 - EventTypeAccountContactRequestIncomingAccepted: EventTypeAccountContactRequestIncomingAccepted indicates the payload includes that the account has accepted a contact request
 - EventTypeAccountContactBlocked: EventTypeAccountContactBlocked indicates the payload includes that the account has blocked a contact
 - EventTypeAccountContactUnblocked: EventTypeAccountContactUnblocked indicates the payload includes that the account has unblocked a contact
 - EventTypeContactAliasKeyAdded: EventTypeContactAliasKeyAdded indicates the payload includes that the contact group has received an alias key
 - EventTypeMultiMemberGroupAliasResolverAdded: EventTypeMultiMemberGroupAliasResolverAdded indicates the payload includes that a member of the group sent their alias proof
 - EventTypeMultiMemberGroupInitialMemberAnnounced: EventTypeMultiMemberGroupInitialMemberAnnounced indicates the payload includes that a member has authenticated themselves as the group owner
 - EventTypeMultiMemberGroupAdminRoleGranted: EventTypeMultiMemberGroupAdminRoleGranted indicates the payload includes that an admin of the group granted another member as an admin
 - EventTypeGroupReplicating: EventTypeGroupReplicating indicates that the group has been registered for replication on a server
 - EventTypeAccountVerifiedCredentialRegistered: EventTypeAccountVerifiedCredentialRegistered
 - EventTypeGroupMetadataPayloadSent: EventTypeGroupMetadataPayloadSent indicates the payload includes an app specific event, unlike messages stored on the message store it is encrypted using a static key

public_key.title: public_key is the identifier of the group, it signs the group secret and the initial member of a multi-member group

secret.title: secret is the symmetric secret of the group, which is used to encrypt the metadata

secret_sig.title: secret_sig is the signature of the secret used to ensure the validity of the group

group_type.title: group_type specifies the type of the group, used to determine how device chain key is generated

sign_pub.title: sign_pub is the signature public key used to verify entries, not required when secret and secret_sig are provided

link_key.title: link_key is the secret key used to exchange group updates and links to attachments, useful for replication services

link_key_sig.title: link_key_sig is the signature of the link_key using the group private key

v1Group.title: Group define a group and is enough to invite someone to it

group.title: group is the group invitation, containing the group pk and its type

member_pk.title: member_pk is the identifier of the current member in the group

device_pk.title: device_pk is the identifier of the current device in the group

event_context.title: event_context contains context information about the event

headers.title: headers contains headers of the secure message

message.title: message contains the secure message payload

event_type.title: event_type defines which event type is used

payload.title: the serialization depends on event_type, event is symmetrically encrypted

sig.title: sig is the signature of the payload, it depends on the event_type for the used key

v1GroupMetadata.title: GroupMetadata is used in GroupEnvelope and only readable by invited group members

event_context.title: event_context contains context information about the event

metadata.title: metadata contains the newly available metadata

event.title: event_clear clear bytes for the event

v1GroupType.description:
- GroupTypeUndefined: GroupTypeUndefined indicates that the value has not been set. For example, happens if group is replicated.
 - GroupTypeAccount: GroupTypeAccount is the group managing an account, available to all its devices.
 - GroupTypeContact: GroupTypeContact is the group created between two accounts, available to all their devices.
 - GroupTypeMultiMember: GroupTypeMultiMember is a group containing an undefined number of members.

counter.title: counter is the current counter value for the specified device

device_pk.title: device_pk is the public key of the device sending the message

sig.title: sig is the signature of the encrypted message using the device's private key

metadata.title: metadata allow to pass custom informations

v1MessageHeaders.title: MessageHeaders is used in MessageEnvelope and only readable by invited group members

group_pk.title: group_pk is the identifier of the newly created group

group.title: group is the invitation to the group

routes.description: routes are the list of active and known maddr.

errors.description: errors is a list of errors related to the peer.

features.description: Features is a list of available features.

min_latency.description: MinLatency is the minimum latency across all the peer routes.

is_active.description: IsActive is true if at least one of the route is active.

direction.description: Direction is the aggregate of all the routes's direction.

account_pk.title: account_pk is the public key of the current account

device_pk.title: device_pk is the public key of the current device

account_group_pk.title: account_group_pk is the public key of the account group

peer_id.title: peer_id is the peer ID of the current IPFS node

listeners.title: listeners is the list of swarm listening addresses of the current IPFS node

encoded_contact.description: encoded_contact is the Protobuf encoding of the ShareableContact. You can further encode the bytes for sharing, such as base58 or QR code.

pk.title: pk is the account to send a contact request to

public_rendezvous_seed.title: public_rendezvous_seed is the rendezvous seed used by the account to send a contact request to

metadata.title: metadata is the metadata specific to the app to identify the contact for the request
